title: Meta Appoints Former Trump Adviser to Leadership Role
summary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, has appointed Dina Powell McCormick as its new president and vice chairman. This announcement, made on Monday, highlights her transition from a board member to a key management position where she will oversee strategy and multi-billion-dollar investments. Powell McCormick brings extensive experience from her roles in the Trump and Bush administrations, including as a national security adviser, and from her long career in finance, notably at Goldman Sachs and BDT & MSD Partners. Donald Trump praised the decision on Truth Social, calling it a great choice, while CEO Mark Zuckerberg emphasized her global relationships and financial expertise as assets for Meta's future growth. Her background also includes corporate board positions at companies like Exxon Mobil, and she is married to Senator David McCormick, adding to her political connections. This appointment reflects Meta's strategy to integrate government and financial insights into its tech operations.
